Posts.Content: stacymo wrote: Hello.  I have been diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma.  I am at a point now where I have to make my decision on what I have to do.  I have talked with a surgeon, genetic counselor (I am 34 and breast cancer DOES NOT run in our family), a plastic surgeon and tomorrow I am talking with an oncologist.  I feel that they are all waiting to see what I choose to do about "sid" (that's what I named the beastly tumor).  I am so confused - I am so afraid of going through all of this over again. Lumpectomy, masectomy, double masectomy???  Any advice crom the veterans??  I am gathering as much info as I can, trying to do what is best, but what is best?  Any advice would help at this point.   Has anyone out there taken the leap and had the other breast removed when it appeared "healthy"?  Is that too radical? SOrry - going nuts over here.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Options stacymo pinoideae
